author: markbrus88
title: Arsenal’s Mesut Ozil ruled out of Germany vs England by Joachim Low

persons.name: shkodran mustafi jonas hector benedikt howedes mats hummels antonio rudiger niklas sule joshua kimmich sebastian rudy midfielders  sami khedira julian draxler toni kroos mesut ozil emre can julian weigl leroy sane julian brandt
andre schurrle lukas podolski thomas muller mario gomez timo werner

text:
Joachim Low says Ozil is out of the England match with a hamstring problem (Picture: Getty) Arsenal star Mesut Ozil has a hamstring injury that will rule him out of Germany’s upcoming international game against England, manager Joachim Low has confirmed.
Time for a reality check: Arsenal is as good as it's going to get for Mesut Ozil The 28-year-old missed the Gunners’ defeat to West Brom at the weekend after an injury concern, and despite joining up with the Germany squad, he has not recovered sufficiently to play a part against the Three Lions.
The reigning world champions take on England in Dortmund tomorrow evening, and will have to make do without Ozil, according to the London Evening Standard .
Mesut Ozil’s absence could be a big blow for Germany (Picture: Getty) Germany boss Low also confirmed that Julian Draxler and Mario Gomez were also set to miss the friendly, though their superb squad should still have the depth to cope with some high-profile absentees.

Timo Werner More: Football Arsene Wenger reportedly signs new two-year contract with Arsenal 
International manager hails Chelsea star as world's best 
With the World Cup looming the Gareth Southgate era begins 
Reports earlier today suggested Arsene Wenger was ‘furious’ with Ozil for missing the West Brom game before linking up with Germany, but it seems he clearly was not in a fit state to take part.
Arsenal’s Shkodran Mustafi, Liverpool’s Emre Can and Manchester City’s Leroy Sane are among other Premier League players who could play apart against England on Wednesday night.
MORE: Ozil's top-level career is over if he leaves Arsenal
